name: EvalError
description: Creates an instance representing an error that occurs regarding the global function eval().

parameters.name: EvalError()
parameters.description: Creates a new EvalError object.

parameters.name: EvalError.prototype.constructor
parameters.description: The constructor function that created the instance object. For EvalError instances, the initial value is the EvalError constructor.

parameters.name: EvalError.prototype.name
parameters.description: Represents the name for the type of error. For EvalError.prototype.name, the initial value is "EvalError".

name: RangeError
description: Creates an instance representing an error that occurs when a numeric variable or parameter is outside its valid range.

parameters.name: RangeError()
parameters.description: Creates a new RangeError object.

parameters.name: RangeError.prototype.constructor
parameters.description: The constructor function that created the instance object. For RangeError instances, the initial value is the RangeError constructor.

parameters.name: RangeError.prototype.name
parameters.description: Represents the name for the type of error. For RangeError.prototype.name, the initial value is "RangeError".

name: ReferenceError
description: Creates an instance representing an error that occurs when de-referencing an invalid reference.

parameters.name: ReferenceError()
parameters.description: Creates a new ReferenceError object.

parameters.name: ReferenceError.prototype.constructor
parameters.description: The constructor function that created the instance object. For ReferenceError instances, the initial value is the ReferenceError constructor.

parameters.name: ReferenceError.prototype.name
parameters.description: Represents the name for the type of error. For ReferenceError.prototype.name, the initial value is "ReferenceError".

name: SyntaxError
description: Creates an instance representing a syntax error.

parameters.name: SyntaxError()
parameters.description: Creates a new SyntaxError object.

parameters.name: SyntaxError.prototype.constructor
parameters.description: The constructor function that created the instance object. For SyntaxError instances, the initial value is the SyntaxError constructor.

parameters.name: SyntaxError.prototype.name
parameters.description: Represents the name for the type of error. For SyntaxError.prototype.name, the initial value is "SyntaxError".

name: TypeError
description: Creates an instance representing an error that occurs when a variable or parameter is not of a valid type.

parameters.name: TypeError()
parameters.description: Creates a new TypeError object.

parameters.name: TypeError.prototype.constructor
parameters.description: The constructor function that created the instance object. For TypeError instances, the initial value is the TypeError constructor.

parameters.name: TypeError.prototype.name
parameters.description: Represents the name for the type of error. For TypeError.prototype.name, the initial value is "TypeError".

name: URIError
description: Creates an instance representing an error that occurs when encodeURI() or decodeURI() are passed invalid parameters.

parameters.name: URIError()
parameters.description: Creates a new URIError object.

parameters.name: URIError.prototype.constructor
parameters.description: The constructor function that created the instance object. For URIError instances, the initial value is the URIError constructor.

parameters.name: URIError.prototype.name
parameters.description: Represents the name for the type of error. For URIError.prototype.name, the initial value is "URIError".

name: AggregateError
description: Creates an instance representing several errors wrapped in a single error when multiple errors need to be reported by an operation, for example by Promise.any().

parameters.name: AggregateError()
parameters.description: Creates a new AggregateError object.

parameters.name: AggregateError.prototype.constructor
parameters.description: The constructor function that created the instance object. For AggregateError instances, the initial value is the AggregateError constructor.

parameters.name: AggregateError.prototype.name
parameters.description: Represents the name for the type of error. For AggregateError.prototype.name, the initial value is "AggregateError".

parameters.name: errors
parameters.description: An array representing the errors that were aggregated.

name: InternalError
description: Creates an instance representing an error that occurs when an internal error in the JavaScript engine is thrown. E.g. "too much recursion".

parameters.name: InternalError()
parameters.description: Creates a new InternalError object.

parameters.name: InternalError.prototype.constructor
parameters.description: The constructor function that created the instance object. For InternalError instances, the initial value is the InternalError constructor.

parameters.name: InternalError.prototype.name
parameters.description: Represents the name for the type of error. For InternalError.prototype.name, the initial value is "InternalError".

name: Error()
description: Creates a new Error object.

parameters.name: message
parameters.description: A human-readable description of the error.

parameters.name: options
parameters.description:
An object that has the following properties:

cause Optional

A value indicating the specific cause of the error, reflected in the cause property. When catching and re-throwing an error with a more-specific or useful error message, this property can be used to pass the original error.

parameters.name: cause
parameters.description: A value indicating the specific cause of the error, reflected in the cause property. When catching and re-throwing an error with a more-specific or useful error message, this property can be used to pass the original error.

parameters.name: fileName
parameters.description: The path to the file that raised this error, reflected in the fileName property. Defaults to the name of the file containing the code that called the Error() constructor.

parameters.name: lineNumber
parameters.description: The line number within the file on which the error was raised, reflected in the lineNumber property. Defaults to the line number containing the Error() constructor invocation.

name: Error.captureStackTrace()
description: A non-standard V8 function that creates the stack property on an Error instance.

name: Error.stackTraceLimit
description: A non-standard V8 numerical property that limits how many stack frames to include in an error stacktrace.

name: Error.prepareStackTrace()
description: A non-standard V8 function that, if provided by usercode, is called by the V8 JavaScript engine for thrown exceptions, allowing the user to provide custom formatting for stacktraces.

name: Error.prototype.constructor
description: The constructor function that created the instance object. For Error instances, the initial value is the Error constructor.

name: Error.prototype.name
description: Represents the name for the type of error. For Error.prototype.name, the initial value is "Error". Subclasses like TypeError and SyntaxError provide their own name properties.

name: Error.prototype.stack
description: A non-standard property for a stack trace.

name: cause
description: Error cause indicating the reason why the current error is thrown â usually another caught error. For user-created Error objects, this is the value provided as the cause property of the constructor's second argument.

name: columnNumber
description: A non-standard Mozilla property for the column number in the line that raised this error.

name: fileName
description: A non-standard Mozilla property for the path to the file that raised this error.

name: lineNumber
description: A non-standard Mozilla property for the line number in the file that raised this error.

name: message
description: Error message. For user-created Error objects, this is the string provided as the constructor's first argument.

name: Error.prototype.toString()
description: Returns a string representing the specified object. Overrides the Object.prototype.toString() method.
return_value: A string representing the specified Error object.
